title: Why buying insurance on price comparison websites could invalidate your claim
text:
Customers buying home insurance through price comparison websites may have their claims rejected by insurers through no fault of their own.

Firms such as Moneysupermarket and Confused.com use technology that pre-fills information about consumers’ houses, including when a home was built, how many rooms it has and what type of property it is.

The problem is that these firms can get this information wrong. If a customer does not spot any errors before the comparison website sends the information to an insurer, it can invalidate a claim, as the insurer might think the customer has lied.
